column5: any body know what the water conditions are like on Kempenfelt bay this morning , sorry but i am just new  yet at this game to be able to tell from so far inland ....................just trying to find out if i should be out fishing or going back to work in the mud...

definitely fishing! I passed by an hour ago and things looked fine other than the odd shower (unless wind has picked up since then). As long as you're not in a rubber dingy I'd say go, you can always stay close to shore.

Thanks , just did'nt want to take an hour to get out pass Big Bay Point in rough water , done it to many times last week , this time thought i'd ask first , the rain is forcast but its hard to stay seated when the sun shows thru...... lol .

Hey Skipper  This report might be a little late for Ya!  But as of about 1300Hrs we have winds from the WNW at about 25-30 Klicks!  So unless you are going to fish the very west end or tight to the North shore of K-Bay I would not make the trip over.  and out at BBP it will be rolling Whitecaps for sure.  Rick

Thanks Rick , i solved the problem of having to decide , i fell a sleep right after i made the posting , just woke up now 2:45 , i think i needed it . After what you said i am glad i am not out there , spendt eight hours in that last saturday

the link eludes me but are there not some live action harbour cams on kempenflet bay? maybe it was the weather channel or something. you could check current conditions before you  left.. some body must know the web link??

Hi there SMALLY , Not so  every will think i am totaly incapable  , i was useing the weather network on line to get the marine focast but foud it no wheres ner accurate for the most part once i got out there , i was'nt aware of any cams on the bay but you know i've never checked before , i'll have to have a look online and see if there is such a link , hell that would be great if there was . But hec  asking some one on here that might live on the bay would be first hand i thought as i would be first to reply to some one if i did .
try this site in the future    http://www.windfinder.com/forecast/barrie_lake_simcoe
